source.author: Entwisle, T.J.
source.title: Thymelaeaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: From: Entwisle, T.J. (1996). Thymelaeaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaves usually narrowly elliptic, medium to dark green on upper surface; involucral bracts ovate or rarely lanceolate
Leaves usually more or less linear, dark bluish-green or dark green on upper surface; involucral bracts lanceolate or rarely ovate; Grampians and Wilsons Promontory
Leaves usually glaucous, upper and lower surfaces similar in colour; flowers usually more than twice as long as bracts; north-eastern mountains
Leaves medium to dark green, usually paler on lower surface; flowers usually not much longer than bracts
